algorithm_technique: two pointers with monotonic function property
problem_summary_simple: Find pairs (x, y) such that f(x, y) equals a target value z.
problem_summary_technical: Utilizes the monotonic property of f(x, y) to employ a two-pointer approach, starting from (1, 1) and adjusting pointers based on function output.
key_insights: The monotonic nature of f(x, y) is key to the two-pointer approach.
When f(x, y) > z, decreasing y is optimal. When f(x, y) < z, increasing x is optimal.
This avoids a brute-force O(N^2) check.
